result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Breyanna L Edwards appeared by video.  Attorney Kirk R. Emick in court for Breyanna L Edwards.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is in compliance with the terms of the agreement and has attended all office contacts. Defendant needs to complete community service hours and the essay. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:45 am.
Received and Filed: DPA Progress Report October 4, 2022

Defendant Breyanna L Edwards in court with attorney Kirk R. Emick.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Addendum to Plea Questionnaire

Jury Instruction 1441

Defendant Breyanna L Edwards in court with attorney Kirk R. Emick.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense counsel and defendant appear by Zoom. Defense requests a DPA hearing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Breyanna L Edwards in court with attorney Kirk R. Emick.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense seeking DPA resolution and requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Breyanna L Edwards in court with Attorney Kirk R. Emick; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared  in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Oral No Contact Order with Lowe's located at 12000 W Burleigh St, Wauwatosa, WI 53222

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 03/18/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
